title: Belief Updating and Sequential Learning
description: Mechanisms for updating probabilistic beliefs as new evidence arrives over time.
learning_objectives: Apply filtering and prediction in dynamic systems
Handle uncertainty in sequential decision making

content.overview: Belief updating describes how rational agents modify their beliefs about the world as they receive new evidence. Sequential learning allows agents to accumulate knowledge over time while maintaining uncertainty quantification.

sequential_bayes.mathematical_form: P(θ | x₁, x₂, ..., xₜ) ∝ P(xₜ | θ, x₁, ..., xₜ₋₁) * P(θ | x₁, ..., xₜ₋₁)
sequential_bayes.interpretation: Update beliefs using new evidence and previous posterior

filtering_methods.description: Optimal filtering for linear Gaussian systems
equations: Update: μₜ = μₜ₋ + Kₜ (zₜ - H μₜ₋)

filtering_methods.description: Monte Carlo approximation for nonlinear systems
filtering_methods.process: Represent posterior as weighted particle set

filtering_methods.description: General framework for recursive state estimation
filtering_methods.predict_step: P(xₜ | z₁:ₜ₋₁) = ∫ P(xₜ | xₜ₋₁) P(xₜ₋₁ | z₁:ₜ₋₁) dxₜ₋₁
filtering_methods.update_step: P(xₜ | z₁:ₜ) ∝ P(zₜ | xₜ) P(xₜ | z₁:ₜ₋₁)

evidence_accumulation.likelihood_ratio: Update beliefs by multiplying likelihood ratios
evidence_accumulation.log_odds: Convert to log space for numerical stability
evidence_accumulation.confidence_buildup: Evidence strength increases with sample size

examples.name: Coin Flipping Experiment
examples.description: Learning bias of a coin through repeated flips
examples.interpretation: Beta distribution naturally updates with binary outcomes

connections_to_active_inference.perceptual_inference: Continuous belief updating from sensory input
connections_to_active_inference.prediction: Predictive models updated through prediction errors

Compare different filtering methods on example problems

common_misconceptions.clarification: Only if evidence is informative about the hypothesis
Can handle partial and noisy observations
Different types of uncertainty require different handling
